Viewing the Task Menu

The Task menu is available on the main window only when the Task component has been selected from the upper pane. The availability of the Task component is governed by your application license. Depending upon the privileges assigned to you and the activities you are performing, some of the task options may not be enabled. A check mark in front of a menu option indicates that the option has been selected.

New...

Create a new task.

New Subtask...

Create a new subtask.

Add Work...

Click to add a work record to the selected task. You can add work only to tasks that have no subtasks.

Properties

Review or change properties for the selected task.

Print...

Print the data displayed in the upper pane for the selected tasks.

Send To...

Send a copy of a task to one or more team members via e-mail.

Save Shortcut...

Create a shortcut to the selected task. You can use the shortcut to start the application, open the project view in the configuration in which the shortcut was created, and open the Properties dialog for the selected task.

Lock/Unlock

Lock or unlock the selected tasks.

Compare Properties

Compare the properties of two selected tasks.

Labels

New: Create a new revision label and attach it to the selected task or tasks.

Attach: Add an existing label to the selected task or tasks.

Detach: Remove a label from the selected task or tasks.

Advanced

Convert Archive...: Convert archives from the Native-I format to the Native-II format.

Export: Export the data displayed in the upper pane for use in a spreadsheet, database, or other application.

Behavior: Review or change the behavior of the selected task. You can change its Branch on change check box or reconfigure the task as it was at a time in the past.

Item Access Rights...: Review or change task access rights.

Component Access Rights...: Review or change component access rights.

Customize...: Create custom fields that become task properties.

Select

Select All: Select all tasks displayed in the upper pane.

By Query: Select all items displayed in the upper pane that match a particular query.

By Label:Select all items displayed in the upper pane that have a particular label.

Expand All

Expand all groups in the task tree or in the Task list.

Collapse All

Collapse all groups in the task tree or in the Task list.

All Descendants

Display all tasks associated with the folder selected from the application folder hierarchy and all of its child folders. When this option is not selected, the upper pane displays only those tasks associated with the selected folder.

Mark as Read

Display the selected tasks in regular type (not bold), which indicates that they have been read.

Mark as Unread

Display the selected tasks in boldface type, which indicates that they have not been read.

Mark Thread as Unread

Display the entire thread in regular type, which indicates that the tasks it contains have been read.

Mark Thread as Read

Display the entire thread in boldface type, which indicates that the tasks it contains have not been read.

Flag

Click to flag an item. A blue flag appears in the flag field, if that column displays in the upper pane. Only you can see and remove your flags.

Remove Flag

Click to remove the flag from an item. The blue flag disappears from the flag field, if that column displays in the upper pane.

Delete

Delete the selected tasks from the current project view and/or from their working folders.

Find...

Find all tasks containing text that matches the specified text string.

Find Next

Find the next task containing text that matches the specified text string.

Find Previous

Find the previous file containing text that matches the specified text string.

Filters

Show Fields...: Change the column headers that appear in the upper pane.

Sort and Group...: Sort and group the data in the upper pane based on up to four task properties.

Queries...: Create or apply a query. Items that match the query become the rows displayed in the upper pane.

Save Current Settings...: Save the current column headers, query, and method of sorting and grouping as a filter, which can be reapplied in the future.

Reset Current Settings: Return to the current default filter as defined on the server.

Filters...: Display the filters available for this component. This option allows you to select a filter or create a new one. An asterisk preceding a filter name in the filter list box indicates that you have changed the contents of the upper pane since the filter was applied. For example, you may have displayed additional fields, grouped the items differently, or applied another query.

Reports...

Create a report using the selected tasks.

Charts

Simple...: Create a simple chart. A simple chart contains only one series (one line, one row of bars, etc.).

Distribution...: Create a distribution chart. A distribution chart is the same as a pie chart. Each wedge indicates what fraction of the whole a group represents.

Correlation...: Create a correlation chart. A correlation chart shows the relationship or degree of relationship between numeric values in several series.

Time Series..: Create a time series chart. A time-series chart is a line chart that shows the number of items that have the same day, week, or month in the specified time/date field.

Links

Create Link: Start a link from a selected folder to another item.

Complete Link: Complete the link from a folder to the selected item.

Cancel Link: Stop the process of creating a link.

Set Active Process Item

Designate the selected task as the active process item. Active process items are used when you add tasks to a view or check them in.

Clear Active Process Item

Change the selected task from active to inactive. Active process items are used when you add tasks to a view or check them in.

Linked Files

Enabled when one or more files from the current view are linked to a selected item (file, change request, requirement, task, or topic).

Check In:  When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Check In dialog and the linked files will be checked in.

Check Out: When this option is selected, the system presents the standard Check Out dialog (minus the View Configuration option). If the link is pinned, the linked files checked out will be the revisions that were linked. If the link is floating, the linked files checked out will be the tip revisions.

Select All: When this option is selected, the window focus changes to the File tab and all linked files from the current view will be selected. If a linked file is not visible with the current filter and query settings, the user will see a warning that the selection could not be completed.

Add to Selection:  When this option is selected, the window focus changes to the File tab and all of the linked files from the current view will be added to the current file selections. If a linked file is not visible with the current filter and query settings, the user will see a warning that the selection could not be completed.
